intro: Crocus balcanensis, commonly known as the Balkan crocus, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and produces showy, violet-blue flowers in early spring. The plant's leaves are narrow and grass-like, emerging from a basal rosette of fleshy, white underground bulbs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or calcareous habitats. The flowers bloom before the leaves fully develop, making it a striking early spring flora in its native range.
